column4: Help Request - I'm trying to install Ubuntu for the 1st time.  I have a Dell 1920x1200 widescreen LCD monitor.  When I boot the install CD, I get the screen with the little progress indicator for about 30 seconds, then the screen goes blank and my monitor says "Can not display this mode."   I reboot and try hitting F4 to change the resolution but it does not help.   What to do?!
It's possible that you could install with the alternate CD and it would be fine.  The Live CD has limited capabilities for graphical modes b/c of space, but an installed system can be more flexible.
By the install CD, do you mean "Desktop" or "Alternate"?  Desktop is the same as Live.
I'm not sure if you need to; I just know that if you're having graphics trouble at that stage it's worth a shot.
